item.title: Siska add a quote by Lloyd Jones
item.description: "You cannot pretend to read a book. Your eyes will give you away. So will your breathing. A person entranced by a book simply forgets to breathe. The house can catch alight and a reader deep in a book will not look up until the wallpaper is in flames." -- Lloyd Jones

item.title: Siska add a quote by robert harris
item.description: "To say she was my girlfriend was absurd: no one the wrong side of thirty has a girlfriend… I suppose I ought to have realize it’s ominous that forty thousand years of human language had failed to produce a word for our relationship." -- robert harris

item.title: Siska add a quote by Mohamad Sobary
item.description: "Rupanya di malam hari, kesunyian membuat kita lebih peka. Tapi tak setiap orang, tidak juga aku, mampu menjadi penyair." -- Mohamad Sobary

item.title: Siska add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "My gripe is not with lovers of the truth but with truth herself. What succor, what consolation is there in truth, compared to a story? What good is truth, at midnight, in the dark, when the wind is roaring like a bear in the chimney? When the lightning strikes shadows on the bedroom wall and the rain taps at the window with its long fingernails? No. When fear and cold make a statue of you in your bed, don't expect hard-boned and fleshless truth to come running to your aid. What you need are the plump comforts of a story. The soothing, rocking safety of a lie." -- Diane Setterfield
